Class GenericBar

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      GenericBar

public class GenericBar
extends greenfoot.Actor

GenericBar is a Greenfoot Actor that displays a bar that is filled more as the current value approaches the max value. Multiples of this object may be created with no ill effects. Methods included allow for the user to change the color of the bar, place a gradient, or create a new bar with an updated max value, but with all other parameters the same.

Version:
September 25, 2013
Author:
Keith Wong

Constructor Detail

GenericBar

public GenericBar(int maxValue,
                  int genericBarX,
                  int genericBarY,
                  int genericBarHeight,
                  int genericBarWidth,
                  int r,
                  int g,
                  int b)
Creates the bar with a certain height, width, location, and color.

Parameters:
maxValue - the upper limit of the bar.
genericBarX - the x coordinate of the centre of the bar.
genericBarY - the y coordinate of the centre of the bar.
genericBarHeight - the height of the bar.
genericBarWidth - the width of the bar.
r - the color code for r (the "redness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
g - the color code for g (the "greeness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
b - the color code for b (the "blueness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.

GenericBar

public GenericBar(int maxValue,
                  Prey target,
                  int genericBarHeight,
                  int genericBarWidth,
                  int r,
                  int g,
                  int b,
                  int offset)
Creates a bar with a certain height, width and color that follows a certain actor.

Parameters:
maxValue - the upper limit of the bar.
target - the Actor that you want the bar to follow.
genericBarHeight - the height of the bar.
genericBarWidth - the width of the bar.
r - the color code for r (the "redness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
g - the color code for g (the "greeness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
b - the color code for b (the "blueness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.

removeThis

public void removeThis()
Removes this bar from the world.

setEmptyColor

public void setEmptyColor(int rEmpty,
                          int gEmpty,
                          int bEmpty)
Sets the color that the bar will be when it is empty. Used to set the lower limit for the gradient option.

Parameters:
rEmpty - the color code for r when the bar is empty (the "redness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
gEmpty - the color code for g when the bar is empty (the "greeness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
bEmpty - the color code for b when the bar is empty (the "blueness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.

update

public boolean update(int updatedValue)
Updates the Bar with the new current value, and displays it as a percentage of the bar that is filled.

Parameters:
updatedValue - the current value of the bar.
Returns:
boolean returns true if currentValue is equal to the maxValue (when the bar is full), returns false if not.

update

public void update(int r,
                   int g,
                   int b)
Changes the color of the bar.

Parameters:
r - the color code for r (the "redness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
g - the color code for g (the "greeness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
b - the color code for b (the "blueness" of the color). Accepts a value from 0 to 255.
